required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Hepatitis C Testing in VA Community-Based Outpatient Clinics
clinical_study.official_title: Hepatitis C Testing in VA Community-Based Outpatient Clinics (QUE 15-284)

lead_sponsor.agency: VA Office of Research and Development

clinical_study.source: VA Office of Research and Development

brief_summary.textblock: The VISN1 VA Hepatitis C Testing and Linkage to Care Quality Improvement project aims to: (1) increase the proportion of Veterans tested for HCV in those born between 1945-1965 and in vulnerable, high-risk groups, (2) Increase linkage to specialized HCV care among VISN 1 VA Veterans diagnosed with HCV infection, and (3) Evaluate whether race, ethnicity, gender, or other markers of social disparity influence completion of HCV testing and linkage to specialty care, and whether disparities are reduced by the planned VISN 1 VA HCV Quality Improvement (QI) program. The central focus is to reduce delays in diagnosis and linkage to treatment evaluation, management of comorbidities and contraindications, and subsequent initiation.

detailed_description.textblock: The VISN1 VA Hepatitis C Testing and Linkage to Care Quality Improvement project aims to: (1) increase the proportion of Veterans tested for HCV in those born between 1945-1965 and in vulnerable, high-risk groups, (2) Increase linkage to specialized HCV care among VISN 1 VA Veterans diagnosed with HCV infection, and (3) Evaluate whether race, ethnicity, gender, or other markers of social disparity influence completion of HCV testing and linkage to specialty care, and whether disparities are reduced by the planned VISN 1 VA HCV Quality Improvement (QI) program. The central focus is to reduce delays in diagnosis and linkage to treatment evaluation, management of comorbidities and contraindications, and subsequent initiation.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days within outpatient primary care visit
primary_outcome.description: HCV antibody test within 30 days of Outpatient Primary Care. HCV test identified through Lab (LOINC), procedure (CPT4) and diagnosis (ICD-9 and 10) codes Data will be located at the individual level and aggregated to the provider, site, and region.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Veterans
- Born in the period of 1945-1965 ("birth cohort")
- With an outpatient visit in primary care at a VISN1 facility in FY 2016
Exclusion Criteria:

overall_official.affiliation: Edith Nourse Rogers Memorial Veterans Hospital, Bedford, MA
Edith Nourse Rogers Memorial Veterans Hospital, Bedford, MA

facility.name: Edith Nourse Rogers Memorial Veterans Hospital, Bedford, MA
